Warm-Up.title: March in Place
Warm-Up.description: A low-impact exercise that helps warm up the body and improve flexibility, allowing for greater ease of movement and reducing the risk of injury during more intense workouts.
Warm-Up.instructions: March in place, lifting your knees and pumping your arms.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid overstriding. keep your pace light and steady.

Warm-Up.title: Jumping Jacks
Warm-Up.description: A classic cardio exercise that boosts your heart rate and improves cardiovascular fitness, ensuring enhanced blood flow and stamina during physical activities.
Warm-Up.instructions: 1. Stand with feet together and arms at your sides. 2. Jump while spreading your legs and raising your arms. 3. Return to starting position and repeat.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Don't slouch. keep your posture straight. Avoid jerky movements. Ensure a smooth jump and landing.

Warm-Up.title: Mountain Climbers
Warm-Up.description: Mountain Climbers help increase flexibility while engaging core muscles, promoting better movement and range of motion, which supports overall physical and sexual endurance.
Warm-Up.instructions: Start in a plank position. Quickly alternate bringing one knee towards your chest and then the other, keeping your core tight throughout.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips drop or rise. maintain a straight body line.

Warm-Up.title: Pelvic Floor Squeeze
Warm-Up.description: An exercise focusing on contracting and relaxing the pelvic floor muscles to improve stability and control, aiding in maintaining stamina and erection quality.
Warm-Up.instructions: Contract your pelvic floor muscles, hold for a few seconds, then release. Repeat the contraction and release.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid tensing the abdominal muscles. focus on the pelvic area.

Warm-Up.title: Lateral Lunges
Warm-Up.description: Lateral Lunges engage the leg and pelvic muscles, contributing to better endurance and flexibility, which can support longer-lasting sexual performance and increased stamina.
Warm-Up.instructions: Step out to the side with one leg and lower your hips, keeping the other leg straight. Push off with the bent leg to return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your knee extend past your toes. maintain a controlled motion and keep the torso upright.

Warm-Up.title: Pelvic Tilts
Warm-Up.description: Pelvic Tilts target the pelvic region and lower back, improving blood circulation and muscle engagement, which aids in erectile function and overall sexual health.
Warm-Up.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent. Flatten your back against the floor by tilting your pelvis upwards, then relax.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your back. keep movements slow and controlled.

Warm-Up.title: Hold and Release Kegel
Warm-Up.description: Hold and Release Kegel exercises improve pelvic floor strength, aiding in sexual endurance and performance by providing better control over ejaculation and maintaining an erection.
Warm-Up.instructions: 1. Sit or lie down comfortably. 2. Tighten the muscles you'd use to stop urination. 3. Hold and release.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid using your stomach or leg muscles. Focus on pelvic muscles only.

Warm-Up.title: Romanian Deadlifts Right
Warm-Up.description: This balance-based exercise strengthens the hamstrings and pelvic floor, supporting better blood flow and muscle control, which is key to maintaining erectile function.
Warm-Up.instructions: Stand on one leg, hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the other leg back. Return to start and switch legs.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. keep your movements controlled.

Warm-Up.title: Romanian Deadlifts Left
Warm-Up.description: This balance-based exercise strengthens the hamstrings and pelvic floor, supporting better blood flow and muscle control, which is key to maintaining erectile function.
Warm-Up.instructions: Stand on one leg, hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the other leg back. Return to start and switch legs.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. keep your movements controlled.

Warm-Up.title: Standing Toe Touch
Warm-Up.description: The Standing Toe Touch improves flexibility in the hamstrings and lower back, which can help improve posture and stamina during physical activities, including sexual performance.
Warm-Up.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend forward at the hips to touch your toes. Hold the stretch without bouncing.
Warm-Up.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. keep your knees slightly bent.

Main Workout.title: Prone Pelvic Rotations
Main Workout.description: A low-impact exercise that improves flexibility and strengthens the lower back and core, focusing on pelvic stability. This exercise helps warm up the body and enhances mobility, reducing the risk of injury during more intense workouts.
Main Workout.instructions: Start in a prone position, body horizontal to the floor. Extend arms in front of you. Rotate lower back, pelvis, and glutes in slow circular motions. Complete the circle in one direction, then switch directions.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back excessively. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement, and perform the rotations slowly to maintain control and prevent strain.

Main Workout.title: Pelvic Side Press
Main Workout.description: A low-impact exercise that strengthens the lower back and core while improving pelvic stability. This exercise mimics controlled pelvic movements, enhancing coordination and flexibility, often used for improving mobility in the pelvic region.
Main Workout.instructions: Begin in a prone position with your body horizontal to the floor and arms extended in front. Slowly press one side of your lower back toward the ground, alternating sides as if pushing each hip down one at a time. Focus on engaging the pelvic muscles with each press.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid pushing too forcefully, as this can strain the lower back. Maintain control by engaging your core muscles and move slowly. Keep your torso stable to isolate the pelvic movement.

Main Workout.title: Prone Pelvic Thrust
Main Workout.description: A low-impact exercise that strengthens the lower back, core, and pelvic muscles, focusing on controlled thrusting movements. This exercise improves pelvic mobility, stability, and coordination, simulating a forward thrust while maintaining proper form.
Main Workout.instructions: In a prone position with arms extended forward and toes on the ground, engage your core and glutes. Push your pelvis downward in a controlled thrusting motion, keeping legs straight and avoiding any back arching.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid bending your knees or arching your lower back excessively. Keep the movement controlled to engage the pelvic muscles properly and prevent lower back strain. Ensure that the motion comes from the hips and pelvis, not the upper body.

Main Workout.title: Thrust Jumps
Main Workout.description: A dynamic exercise that strengthens the lower back, core, and pelvic muscles, combining a thrusting motion with a jumping movement to increase intensity. This exercise improves pelvic stability, coordination, and flexibility, while engaging the entire lower body and core.
Main Workout.instructions: In a prone position with arms extended forward and toes on the ground, perform a controlled pelvic thrust. Then jump your feet towards your hands in one swift movement to form a V-shape. Keep hands stationary, return to start, and repeat.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips sag during the thrust or arching your lower back. Ensure that your jump is controlled, and avoid using momentum from your upper body. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement to protect your lower back and improve form.

Main Workout.title: Pelvic Attack
Main Workout.description: An intense exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and pelvic muscles, mimicking thrusting motions. This exercise focuses on pelvic stability, improving coordination, mobility, and endurance in the lower body while engaging the core for support.
Main Workout.instructions: In a prone position with hands and toes on the ground and your upper body higher, engage your core and glutes. Perform controlled, rhythmic hip thrusts, moving hips forward and back while keeping your upper body stable.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips sag or raising your body too high during the thrust. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and prevent lower back strain. Ensure that the motion remains controlled and does not rely on momentum.

Main Workout.title: Vertical Hip Swing
Main Workout.description: A dynamic exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and pelvic muscles by incorporating vertical swinging motions. This exercise focuses on pelvic control and stability, improving flexibility, coordination, and endurance in the lower body and core.
Main Workout.instructions: In a prone position with hands and toes on the ground and your upper body elevated, engage your core and glutes. Swing your hips vertically, allowing your knees to lightly touch the ground when swinging down. Thrust your hips upward, lifting your pelvis as if pushing forward. Keep your upper body stable and focus on smooth, rhythmic hip motions.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your hips collapse during the downward swing or using excessive force. Keep the motion controlled and fluid, and engage your core to prevent lower back strain. Ensure that the movement is powered by your hips and pelvis rather than momentum.

Main Workout.title: Sky Thrust
Main Workout.description: An intense exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and pelvic muscles by combining a reverse cat-cow pose with upward thrusting movements. This exercise focuses on pelvic mobility, improving flexibility, stability, and core strength, while engaging the entire lower body.
Main Workout.instructions: Start in a reverse tabletop position with hands and feet on the ground, chest and face facing upward. Your body should form a bridge with hips elevated. Engage your glutes and core, then thrust your hips upward in a controlled motion, as if pushing toward an imaginary target in the sky. Keep feet and hands stable while focusing on smooth, rhythmic pelvic lifts.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid over-arching your lower back during the upward thrust. Maintain control throughout the movement by engaging your core, and ensure that your hips do not dip too low when returning to the starting position. Avoid using momentum; focus on using your pelvic muscles to perform the thrust.

Main Workout.title: Advanced Bridges
Main Workout.description: A foundational exercise that strengthens the glutes, lower back, and core by performing a controlled thrusting motion. The glute bridge improves pelvic stability, core strength, and flexibility in the hips, while engaging the entire posterior chain.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie flat on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor near your glutes. Arms should be by your sides, fingers close to your heels. Engage your glutes and core, then press through your heels to lift your hips, forming a straight line from shoulders to knees. Hold briefly at the top, then slowly lower your hips back to the ground.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid overextending your lower back at the top of the movement. Keep your core engaged throughout to prevent arching, and make sure your knees stay aligned with your hips to avoid strain. Don't use momentumâ€”focus on controlled, smooth movement powered by your glutes.

Main Workout.title: Back Burden
Main Workout.description: A high-intensity pelvic stability exercise that strengthens the core, glutes, and lower back by focusing on rapid, controlled thrusting motions. This exercise enhances pelvic mobility, control, and endurance, mimicking quick pelvic thrusts to engage the lower body effectively.
Main Workout.instructions: Start in a prone position with your body horizontal to the floor, arms extended in front, and only your toes touching the ground. Engage your core and glutes, then push your pelvis forward in rapid, short thrusting motions, mimicking a fast penetration-like movement. Keep your legs straight and maintain toe contact with the ground, focusing on generating the motion from your pelvis.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid excessive force or overextending your back during the thrusts. Keep the movement controlled and quick, powered by your core and pelvic muscles. Ensure your upper body remains stable and avoid using momentum from your torso to assist with the movement.

Main Workout.title: Rotating Back Burden
Main Workout.description: An advanced pelvic stability exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and glutes through rotational thrusting movements. This exercise emphasizes pelvic control and mobility while engaging the muscles of the lower body and core in a dynamic manner, improving stability and coordination.
Main Workout.instructions: Start in a prone position with your body horizontal, arms extended forward, and toes touching the ground. Engage your core and glutes, then rotate your hips side to side while thrusting backward. Move in smooth, controlled circular motions, alternating between pushing your hips backward and slightly upward.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid excessive twisting of the lower back, as this can lead to strain. Keep the motion controlled and avoid relying on momentum from your upper body. Focus on engaging your core and glutes to power the movement, ensuring that the rotation remains steady and does not compromise form.

Main Workout.title: Slanted Hip Thrust
Main Workout.description: A pelvic stability exercise that strengthens the core, lower back, and glutes through controlled, angled thrusting motions. This exercise emphasizes pelvic control, stability, and mobility, focusing on engaging the lower body and core while simulating thrusting motions in a slanted position.
Main Workout.instructions: Start on the ground with your elbows, palms, and knees touching the floor, keeping hips slanted downward. Engage your core and glutes, then thrust your hips forward in a controlled motion, focusing on the pelvic area. Keep your upper body stable, palms pressed into the ground, as your hips move forward and backward in a rhythmic pattern. Bend your legs at a 90-degree angle, with feet slightly elevated off the ground.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back too much or letting your hips dip too low. Keep the movement controlled, powered by your pelvic muscles, and avoid using momentum from your upper body. Focus on engaging the core to maintain stability and prevent strain on the lower back.

Main Workout.title: V-Thrust
Main Workout.description: An advanced pelvic stability exercise that engages the core, lower back, and glutes through rotational thrusting movements. This variation incorporates a V-shaped leg position, enhancing pelvic control, mobility, and stability while strengthening the entire lower body.
Main Workout.instructions: Begin on the floor with your fists together, elbows, palms, and knees touching the ground. Position your legs wide apart in a V shape, with only your toes on the ground. Engage your core and glutes, then thrust your pelvis downward, rotating your lower back in a controlled manner. Maintain stability in your upper body while performing smooth, rhythmic thrusts.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid overextending or twisting your lower back excessively during the thrusts. Keep the movement controlled and steady, ensuring you don't rely on momentum from your upper body. Maintain engagement of your core to prevent strain and support the stability of your lower back throughout the exercise.

Main Workout.title: Deep V-Thrusts
Main Workout.description: A focused pelvic stability exercise that strengthens the core, glutes, and lower back through controlled thrusting motions. This variation features both knees and toes in contact with the ground, enhancing pelvic control and stability while engaging the entire lower body.
Main Workout.instructions: Start in a kneeling position with elbows and palms on the ground, and knees and toes planted. Engage your core and glutes, then thrust your pelvis downward in a smooth, rhythmic motion. Keep your upper body stable and legs in a wide stance for better stability.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid excessive arching of your lower back during the thrusts. Maintain a controlled motion, ensuring you do not rely on momentum from your upper body. Keep your core engaged to prevent strain and support stability throughout the exercise.

Main Workout.title: Supine Leg Raise
Main Workout.description: This core-strengthening exercise targets the lower abdominal muscles, enhancing core stability and promoting overall strength, which is beneficial for improving posture and supporting sexual health.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie on your back with legs extended. Lift your legs to a 90-degree angle, then lower them slowly without touching the ground.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back. keep your legs straight and controlled.

Main Workout.title: Plank
Main Workout.description: The Plank strengthens the core muscles, improving posture, stability, and endurance, all of which contribute to longer-lasting stamina and control during physical and sexual activities.
Main Workout.instructions: 1. Lie face down. 2. Lift your body onto your toes and forearms. 3. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Don't let your hips sag. Keep your body in a straight line and engage your core.

Main Workout.title: Glute Bridges
Main Workout.description: Glute Bridges specifically target the glutes and pelvic floor muscles, enhancing pelvic stability and control, which supports better performance and stamina during sexual activities.
Main Workout.instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Lift your hips towards the ceiling, then lower back down.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back. keep movements controlled.

Main Workout.title: Hip Thrusts
Main Workout.description: Hip Thrusts are designed to strengthen the glutes, hips, and pelvic floor muscles, increasing sexual stamina and promoting better control during intimate activities.
Main Workout.instructions: Sit on the ground with your upper back resting on a bench. Roll a barbell or weight over your hips. Push your hips upward and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back. keep the movement controlled.

Main Workout.title: Sumo Squat
Main Workout.description: Sumo Squats boost leg and pelvic strength while promoting the production of testosterone, which is essential for maintaining sexual health, libido, and performance.
Main Workout.instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed outward. Lower your hips back and down, keeping your knees aligned with your toes. Return to standing position.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid letting knees cave in. keep your back straight and chest up.

Main Workout.title: Romanian Deadlifts Right
Main Workout.description: This balance-based exercise strengthens the hamstrings and pelvic floor, supporting better blood flow and muscle control, which is key to maintaining erectile function.
Main Workout.instructions: Stand on one leg, hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the other leg back. Return to start and switch legs.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. keep your movements controlled.

Main Workout.title: Frog Thrusts
Main Workout.description: A dynamic exercise that mimics the motion of sexual intercourse, focusing on pelvic stability, mobility, and core engagement. This exercise strengthens the lower body, glutes, and pelvic muscles, improving control, endurance, and flexibility during intimate activities.
Main Workout.instructions: Start in a frog-like position with your palms flat on the ground, arms vertical, and knees and toes touching the ground. Your legs should be spread wide, resembling a frog stance. Engage your core and begin thrusting your hips in a controlled, rhythmic motion, simulating the movement of sexual intercourse. Focus on smooth hip movement, keeping your upper body stable while driving the motion from your pelvis.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid using excessive force or letting your lower back arch too much during the thrusts. Maintain control throughout the motion, and ensure your core is engaged to support your lower back and prevent strain. Avoid relying on momentum from the upper body. focus on pelvic-driven movements.

Main Workout.title: Standing Toe Touch
Main Workout.description: The Standing Toe Touch improves flexibility in the hamstrings and lower back, which can help improve posture and stamina during physical activities, including sexual performance.
Main Workout.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend forward at the hips to touch your toes. Hold the stretch without bouncing.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid rounding your back. keep your knees slightly bent.

Main Workout.title: Butterfly Hip Thrusts
Main Workout.description: Butterfly Hip Thrusts target the glutes and pelvic floor, promoting improved sexual stamina and muscle control. This exercise enhances blood flow and strengthens the muscles crucial for better sexual endurance and performance.
Main Workout.instructions: 1. Sit on the ground with your back resting against a bench or elevated surface. 2. Place the soles of your feet together, with knees bent outward. 3. Drive through your heels and thrust your hips upward, squeezing your glutes at the top. 4. Lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Main Workout.common_mistakes: Avoid arching your lower back excessively. focus on using your glutes and core to lift your hips.

Cooldown.title: Standing Quad Stretch Right
Cooldown.description: A stretch focusing on the quadriceps and hips, enhancing flexibility and reducing muscle tension.
Cooldown.instructions: 1. Stand on one leg. 2. Pull the other foot towards your butt with your hand. 3. Keep your knees together. 4. Hold for 10 seconds. 5. Switch legs.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't arch your back. Keep knees together. Stretch gently, no pain. Hold onto something if you're wobbly.

Cooldown.title: Cobra Pose
Cooldown.description: The Cobra Pose opens the chest and stretches the abdomen, promoting relaxation and reducing tension in the body, which helps in releasing stress after physical activity.
Cooldown.instructions: Lie face down, push up with your hands, arching your back and stretching your chest.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't overextend. keep hips on the ground.

Cooldown.title: Child's Pose
Cooldown.description: This calming yoga posture helps release tension in the lower back and hips, promoting relaxation and reducing stress after intense physical activities.
Cooldown.instructions: 1. Kneel on the floor with toes touching and knees apart. 2. Sit back on your heels and extend your arms forward. 3. Rest your forehead on the floor and breathe deeply. 4. Hold for 20 seconds.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't force your forehead to the ground. Keep your arms extended and relaxed. Avoid tensing your shoulders.

Cooldown.title: Diaphragmatic Breathing
Cooldown.description: This breathing exercise focuses on deep, controlled breaths, which help reduce anxiety, lower stress levels, and improve mental clarity after a workout.
Cooldown.instructions: Sit or lie down comfortably. Inhale deeply through the nose, hold briefly, and exhale slowly through the mouth.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid shallow breathing. focus on deep, slow breaths.

Cooldown.title: Spinal Twists
Cooldown.description: Spinal Twists relieve tension in the back and shoulders, promoting relaxation and releasing stress after a workout or long day, supporting overall well-being.
Cooldown.instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides. Bend one knee and bring it across your body towards the opposite side. Keep your shoulders on the ground and hold for 20 seconds per side.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid lifting your shoulders off the ground. keep movements slow and controlled to avoid strain.

Cooldown.title: Standing Toe Touches
Cooldown.description: A stretch that focuses on improving flexibility in the hamstrings and lower back, enhancing overall range of motion and reducing muscle tightness.
Cooldown.instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Reach down towards your toes, keeping your legs straight. Hold for 10 seconds, then slowly return to the starting position.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid bouncing. reach down slowly and maintain a straight back.

Cooldown.title: Chair Pose
Cooldown.description: The Chair Pose engages the lower body and core, promoting muscle growth and testosterone production, which supports overall physical and sexual vitality.
Cooldown.instructions: Stand with feet together, bend your knees and lower your hips as if sitting in a chair. Hold the position with your arms extended overhead.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid letting your knees cave inward. keep your weight in your heels.

Cooldown.title: Cat-Cow Pose
Cooldown.description: This gentle yoga pose helps reduce stress by improving flexibility in the spine and promoting relaxation. It's ideal for reducing tension and promoting mental focus after a workout.
Cooldown.instructions: 1. Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. 2. Inhale as you arch your back, dropping your belly (Cow Pose). 3. Exhale as you round your back, tucking your chin to your chest (Cat Pose). 4. Move smoothly between the two poses, coordinating with your breath. 5. Repeat 12 times.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Don't rush. move slowly and with control. Avoid straining your neck. keep it relaxed. Keep your movements fluid, not jerky. Focus on deep breathing for better results.

Cooldown.title: Hold and Release Kegel
Cooldown.description: Hold and Release Kegel exercises improve pelvic floor strength, aiding in sexual endurance and performance by providing better control over ejaculation and maintaining an erection.
Cooldown.instructions: 1. Sit or lie down comfortably. 2. Tighten the muscles you'd use to stop urination. 3. Hold and release.
Cooldown.common_mistakes: Avoid using your stomach or leg muscles. Focus on pelvic muscles only.
